subject: Re:[junit] Creating logs
msgSnippet: hi Prachi, I have 2 suggestions: a) Use Log4J framework (log4j.apache.org) or; b) You can use AspectJ (which is a cleaner way to include log code). (see
messageBody:
hi Prachi,

I have 2 suggestions:

a) Use Log4J framework (log4j.apache.org) or;

b) You can use AspectJ (which is a cleaner way to include log
code). (see www.aspectj.org or refer to the book AspectJ in
Action, Raminvas Laddad).

Anderson
>
> ---------- Início da mensagem original -----------
> De: "prachi_qa" <prachi_qa@...>
> Para: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Cc:

> Assunto: [junit] Creating logs
> Hi,
> I am using HTTPUnit for unit testing of some of my web appli
cations.
> Currently any comment I write using System.out.println("")
is not
> visible when any of my Junit tests pass. I would like to cre
ate some
> sort of log for printing these messages. Can u pls guide me
how can
> it be done.
> Thanks
> Prachi
